definition: to make into/to change into/-ization/to ... -ize/to transform/abbr. for 化學|化学[hua4 xue2]
the New Culture Movement (mid-1910s and 1920s), intellectual revolution against Confucianism aiming to introduce Western elements, especially democracy and science
Yangshao neolithic culture from the central Yellow river basin, with red and black pottery
Liangzhu (c. 3400-2250 BC), neolithic culture of Changjiang delta

sentences.english: A cultural icon, he is widely known by the single name Elvis.
sentences.chinese: 作为一个文化符号，他的名字埃尔维斯也广为人知。

sentences.english: Chapter three explores how to lead the primary school language teaching into the local culture of study in primary schools.
sentences.chinese: 第三章探究了小学语文教学引入如东地方文化的实践。

sentences.english: This is one of many cultural chasms across the Atlantic.
sentences.chinese: 这只是横跨大西洋的诸多文化鸿沟之一。

sentences.english: Three generations of hereditary patriarchal system is rather profound social basis of Confucian culture.
sentences.chinese: 三代遗传的宗法制度毋宁是儒家文化的深厚社会基础。

sentences.english: This paper talks about related problems with campus culture construction in higher institutes .
sentences.chinese: 本文对高校校园文化建设的相关问题加以论述。

sentences.english: Deputy Mayor He Jihua meets with principal members of Kagoshima Cultural Exchange Group.
sentences.chinese: 市长何寄华会见鹿儿岛文化艺术交流团的主要成员。

sentences.english: Chinese culture sees all non-Chinese as sub-human, to be exploited.
sentences.chinese: 中国文化把所有的其他人种视为有待剥削的次等民族。

sentences.english: We are the country with five-thousand-year culture, old buildings are one of the evidences.
sentences.chinese: 我们是用五千年文化的国家，旧建筑物的依据之一。

sentences.english: The South Korean government spends millions promoting contemporary Korean culture abroad.
sentences.chinese: 韩国政府花了数百万的钱推广当代韩国文化。

sentences.english: Hooley 's Irish Pub brings an authentic slice of Irish culture to Guangzhou.
sentences.chinese: 胡利的爱尔兰酒吧给广州带来了真正的爱尔兰文化片。

sentences.english: The Folk Songs of Northern Shaanxi is the most representative artistic form ofthe Loess Culture.
sentences.chinese: 陕北民歌是黄土文化中最具代表性的艺术形式。

sentences.english: He has a better eye for similarities among cultures than for diversities.
sentences.chinese: 他看各种文化之间的相似点比看其相异点更为透彻。

sentences.english: We continued our select coastal journey in Fujian, which boasts scenic beauty and a brilliant cultural tradition.
sentences.chinese: 我们在风光秀美，文化灿烂的福建继续海疆精华之旅。

sentences.english: There is inevitable connection between the Manchu culture and the source of Jin culture.
sentences.chinese: 满族文化和金源文化之间存在着必然的关联。

sentences.english: There is inevitable connection between the Manchu culture and the source of Jin culture.
sentences.chinese: 满族文化和金源文化之间存在着必然的关联。

sentences.english: Fuxin Mongolian drama has a unique form of expression and the cultural charm.
sentences.chinese: 阜新蒙古剧有着独特的表现形式和文化魅力。

definition: to pass on (to future generations)/passed on (from former times)/a continued tradition/an inheritance
lit. source is distant and the flow is long (idiom); fig. sth goes back to the dim and distant past/a lot of water has flowed under the bridge since then
